author: MSAdministrator
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------
It seems that you cannot set a TypeName on `Strings` in PowerShell Core 5.1 or 6+.

```powershell
$a = 'a'
$a.PSObject.TypeNames.Insert(0,'Example.Custom.Type')
$a.PSOBject.TypeNames

System.String
System.Object
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
A `System.String` TypeName can be set.
```powershell
$a = 'a'
$a.PSObject.TypeNames.Insert(0,'Example.Custom.Type')
$a.PSOBject.TypeNames

Example.Custom.Type
System.String
System.Object
```

Actual behavior
---------------
A `System.String` TypeName cannot be set.
```powershell
$a = 'a'
$a.PSObject.TypeNames.Insert(0,'Example.Custom.Type')
$a.PSOBject.TypeNames

System.String
System.Object
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.2
OS                             Darwin 17.7.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.7.0: Thu Jun 21 22:53:14 PDT 2018; root:xnu-4570.71.2~1/RELEASE_X...
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: BrucePay
comments.body: This appears to be a duplicate of the bug @markekraus  mentioned.

comments.author: DHowett
comments.body: At the bottom of that bug is a comment from @MSAdministrator wherein they say they’ll file a separate bug for strings not being able to hold custom type names. _This_ appears to be that issue.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
@BrucePay This is the bug report. I was only referencing another issue where this was discussed for context. @MSAdministrator had originally filed an issue on something else for which this issued ended up being the root cause.

Would you be so kind as to answer if String PSObjects should allow for custom type names?

title: Unable to set custom type on system.string objects
